newsData.title: How Trump’s Attacks on the Fed Chair Have Intensified
newsData.summary: President Trump has targeted Jerome H. Powell on more than 70 separate occasions, more than half of them since April. His statements fall into four broad categories.

newsData.title: Trump Spars With Powell Over Fed’s Costly Renovations in Rare Visit
newsData.summary: The administration has repeatedly criticized Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the central bank, for his handling of the economy and the cost of work on the institution’s headquarters.

newsData.title: ‘Unprecedented’ Investment Fund Seals Deal for Japan and Expands Trump’s Influence
newsData.summary: President Trump will get to decide where to invest Japanese money and the United States will keep 90 percent of the profits, the White House said.

newsData.title: Trump’s Tariffs Are the Highest in a Century. But After His Threats, They Seem Like a Relief.
newsData.summary: The president imposed tariffs on Japan, one of America’s closest allies, that would have been alarming just months ago. And markets went up.

newsData.title: In New Deal, Trump Keeps Tariffs While Indonesia Drops Trade Barriers
newsData.summary: The administration provided some insight into the terms that were agreed upon between Indonesia and the United States, hinting at how other vague and hastily negotiated deals may turn out.

newsData.title: White House Keeps Pressure on Powell Over Rate Cuts and Renovations
newsData.summary: President Trump and his top aides have criticized Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, for his management of both the economy and a $2.5 billion revamp of the central bank’s headquarters.

newsData.title: As Trump Courts a More Assertive Beijing, China Hawks Are Losing Out
newsData.summary: The Trump administration has dialed back aggressive measures against China and reversed its position on technology controls as the president angles for a Chinese trip later this year.

newsData.title: Indonesia Confirms U.S. Trade Agreement, but Details Remain Scarce
newsData.summary: President Trump said the agreement would partly walk back some of the steep tariffs he threatened on the country last week. Indonesia’s president called Mr. Trump a “tough negotiator.”

newsData.title: Rising Inflation Underscores Risks in Trump’s New Tariff Threats
newsData.summary: New data showing price increases last month could foreshadow even higher costs if the president imposes steep tariffs on Aug. 1.

newsData.title: Another Casualty in the Tariff Wars: The Always-in-Season Tomato
newsData.summary: The Trump administration is adding a 17 percent tariff to a year-round grocery store staple, while funneling more business to domestic tomato growers, largely in Florida.

newsData.title: The Economy Has Been Resilient. The New Round of Tariffs May Hit Harder.
newsData.summary: The economy’s resilience so far to President Trump’s global trade war risks emboldening him and unleashing the sort of economic devastation that economists have long feared.

newsData.title: It’s No Bluff: The Tariff Rate Is Soaring Under Trump
newsData.summary: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.

newsData.title: Under Attack by Trump’s Tariffs, Asian Countries Seek Out Better Friends
newsData.summary: Most nations are still negotiating in hopes of avoiding punitive import taxes. At the same time, they’re looking for trading partners as a way around the United States.

newsData.title: Tariffs or Deals? Trump Seems Content With Punishing Levies.
newsData.summary: The president’s supporters portray him as a top dealmaker. But, at least for now, far more trading partners have gotten stiff tariffs than trade deals.

newsData.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
newsData.summary: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will do next.

newsData.title: Trump Tariffs Aim to Settle Scores With Countries, No Matter Their Size
newsData.summary: The president’s tariff announcements suggest he has not backed away from his initial strategy, where even smaller trading partners will face tariffs.

newsData.title: Trump Treats Tariffs More as a Form of Power Than as a Trade Tool
newsData.summary: Instead of viewing tariffs as part of a broader trade policy, President Trump sees them as a valuable weapon he can wield on the world stage.

newsData.title: With Taxes and Tariffs in Place, Trump Takes Reins of U.S. Economy
newsData.summary: President Trump has achieved much of his agenda, leaving the fate of the economy squarely in his hands.

newsData.title: Trump’s New Trade Threats Set Off Global Scramble to Avoid Tariffs
newsData.summary: Many countries thought they were negotiating in good faith. The White House renewed its “reciprocal” tariff plan anyway, giving countries until Aug. 1 to make offers.

newsData.title: E.U., Mexico, Brazil: Who Has Trump Targeted With New Tariffs?
newsData.summary: President Trump has told more than two dozen countries that they will face tariffs of at least 20 percent on Aug. 1 if they don’t reach agreements by then.

newsData.title: Trump Revives Trade War, Threatening Steep Aug. 1 Tariffs on Allies
newsData.summary: President Trump said Japan and South Korea would face tariffs of 25 percent unless they reached an agreement with the United States. Other countries received notice of higher levies.

newsData.title: Trump Keeps Foreign Countries on Edge as Tariff Deadline Nears
newsData.summary: The president is again threatening higher tariff rates on a dozen foreign nations, as a deadline elapses this week for making trade deals.
